page_analysis.text_content:
Fig 4 Types of porches and entry ways

A Roofed porch

B Roofed entry way
(not vaulted)

C Vaulted entry way

D Combination porch & vaulted entry way

See how to measure height of porches &
entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13

Height
greater than 12'
above grade

Height
less than 12'
above grade

Height
greater than 12'
above grade

visual_elements.description: Four architectural elevation drawings showing different types of porches and entry ways. Drawing A shows a single-story building with a roofed porch supported by columns. Drawing B shows a two-story house with a small roofed entry way. Drawing C shows a two-story colonial-style building with dormer windows and a vaulted entry way. Drawing D shows a building combining both a porch and vaulted entry way with arched openings.
visual_elements.location: Center of page, arranged in 2x2 grid format

visual_elements.description: Height measurement indicators showing vertical lines with arrows and text indicating height measurements relative to grade level
visual_elements.location: Right side of drawings C and D, and right side of drawing B

visual_elements.description: Gray text box containing reference information
visual_elements.location: Center of page between the four architectural drawings

structural_elements.main_heading: Fig 4 Types of porches and entry ways

additional_notes: Page appears to be from a technical manual with clear line drawings
Image quality is good with clear text and diagrams
Contains measurement annotations on architectural drawings
cross_references: Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13 for measurement methods of porches and entry features
